other_tests.findings: Anisocytosis and polychromasia of red cells, occasional schistocytes, reduced platelet count, normal-appearing white cells.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The low number of schistocytes on the initial smear led to an impression of an infectious process; later, an increase in schistocytes to 2-3 per high-power field was observed.

other_tests.findings: ADAMTS13 activity level of less than 5%.
other_tests.changes_over_time: ADAMTS13 activity level increased to 62% after treatment, but later fell to undetectable levels.

other_tests.findings: Significant improvement in neurologic deficits; normal platelet count was achieved.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Platelet count increased to 200,000 per cubic millimeter after a single session of plasma exchange post-relapse.

other_tests.findings: Two heterozygous pathogenic sequence variants indicative of inherited TTP.
